question: Which products and customers should we focus on for better forecast accuracy?
content: SELECT DISTINCT CONCAT('01','-',RIGHT([MD],2),'-',LEFT([MD],4)) AS [Month], A.[Key] AS DFU, REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE(A.[Key]), '/', '.'), 1)) AS [Customer], REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE(A.[Key]), '/', '.'), 2)) AS [Product], ROUND(A.qty,0) AS Sales, ROUND(C.Forecast,0) AS Forecast, ROUND(C.Accuracy_Percentage,0) AS [Forecast Accuracy%] FROM [GEN_AI_NEW].[dbo].[Sales_Data] A INNER JOIN (SELECT * FROM (SELECT [Key],[Test_Period], Accuracy AS Accuracy_Percentage,Pred AS Forecast FROM [GEN_AI_NEW].[dbo].[Model_Results] WHERE Model='All Var MLR') B ) C ON A.[Key] = C.[Key] AND A.MD = C.Test_Period WHERE C.Accuracy_Percentage < 50 AND A.[rank] < 10 ORDER BY ROUND(A.qty,0) DESC, [Forecast Accuracy%] DESC;

question: What is the forecast accuracy considering the current causal factors?
content: SELECT CONCAT('01','-',RIGHT([Test_Period],2),'-',LEFT([Test_Period],4)) AS [Month], [Key] AS [DFU], REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE([Key]), '/', '.'), 1)) AS [Customer], REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE([Key]), '/', '.'), 2)) AS [Product], ROUND(SUM(Actuals),0) AS Sales, ROUND(SUM(Pred),0) AS Forecast, ROUND(AVG([Accuracy]),0) AS [Forecast Accuracy%] FROM [GEN_AI_NEW].[dbo].[Model_Results] WHERE model='All Var MLR' AND Accuracy>60 GROUP BY [Test_Period],[Key] ORDER BY [Forecast Accuracy%] DESC,[Month] DESC;

question: Will there be further improvement in forecast accuracy by adding new variables?
content: SELECT CONCAT('01','-',RIGHT(Y.[Test_Period],2),'-',LEFT(Y.[Test_Period],4)) AS [Month], Y.DFU AS [DFU], REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE([DFU]), '/', '.'), 1)) AS [Customer], REVERSE(PARSENAME(REPLACE(REVERSE([DFU]), '/', '.'), 2)) AS [Product], Y.All_Var_Features AS [Exhaustive Causal Factors], Y.Selected_Features AS [Significant Causal Factors], ROUND(AVG(Y.ALL_VAR_ACCURACY),0) AS [Old Forecast Accuracy%], ROUND(AVG(Y.SEL_VAR_ACCURACY),0) AS [Revised Forecast Accuracy%], ROUND(AVG(Y.DELTA_IMPROVEMENT),0) AS Delta_Improvement, CASE WHEN AVG(Y.DELTA_IMPROVEMENT) <= 0 THEN 'No Improvement' ELSE 'Improvement' END AS Improvement_Check FROM (SELECT DISTINCT A.DFU, A.Actuals, A.Test_Period, A.ALL_VAR_FEATURES, A.ALL_VAR_PRED, A.ALL_VAR_ACCURACY, CC.SELECTED_FEATURES, CC.SEL_VAR_PRED, CC.SEL_VAR_ACCURACY, (CC.SEL_VAR_ACCURACY - A.ALL_VAR_ACCURACY) AS DELTA_IMPROVEMENT FROM (SELECT DISTINCT AA.[Key] AS DFU, AA.Features AS ALL_VAR_FEATURES, AA.Test_Period, AA.Actuals, AA.Pred AS ALL_VAR_PRED, AA.Accuracy AS ALL_VAR_ACCURACY, BB.[Rank] FROM (SELECT DISTINCT [Key], Features, Test_Period, Actuals, Pred, Accuracy FROM [GEN_AI_NEW].[dbo].[Model_Results] WHERE model = 'ALL Var MLR') AA LEFT JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT [key], [rank] FROM sales_data) BB ON AA.[Key] = BB.[Key]) A LEFT JOIN (SELECT DISTINCT [Key] AS DFU, Features AS SELECTED_FEATURES, Test_Period, Pred AS SEL_VAR_PRED, Accuracy AS SEL_VAR_ACCURACY FROM [GEN_AI_NEW].[dbo].[Model_Results] WHERE model = 'SEL Var MLR') CC ON A.DFU = CC.DFU AND A.Test_Period = CC.Test_Period) AS Y WHERE [DFU] = 'R01/15/All_Location' AND [DELTA_IMPROVEMENT] > 0 GROUP BY Y.DFU, Y.ALL_VAR_FEATURES, Y.SELECTED_FEATURES, Y.Test_Period ORDER BY AVG(Y.DELTA_IMPROVEMENT) DESC, Month DESC;
